# ğŸ¢ LLC

Anyone can attach an LLC to their wallet, multi-sig or DAO to make agreements and protect their personal assets from their web3 activities.

# Background

The limited liability company (LLC (opens new window)) was a game changer for entity formation. Established in Wyoming in 1977, it offers a hybrid of partnerships and corporations that gives flexibility for members to decide on their taxation status and determine their rights largely through private operating agreements. They are typically anonymous, with only a registered agent and organizer being known to the State and general public.

Delaware extended this internet-friendly format with the creation of the Series LLC (opens new window) concept, which allows a single filing to franchise out separate LLCs under a "master" operating agreement.

# On-chain Formation

LexDAO (opens new window) engineers derived a technique called Ricardian LLC (opens new window) that leveraged the ease of formation offered by Delaware Series LLC law but ensured separation of concerns (opens new window) through the use of NFTs, which guarantees uniqueness for associated entities through each tokenId.

If users select Delaware or Wyoming LLC as an option through the Wrappr app (opens new window), they will receive a mint on an ERC-1155 token that has a sub-Series LLC agreement attached and completed through the terms of the master operating agreement with qualified code deference, stored on Ethereum and IPFS (Delaware copy (opens new window), Wyoming copy (opens new window)).

Creation of a bank account and obtaining an EIN for off-chain matters can be handled by the LexDAO Clinic (opens new window).

The maintenance of the Wrappr LLC filings, registered agent and annual State franchise tax is handled by the KALI (opens new window) team for the public benefit.

# Examples

Examples of DAO LLCs in the wild include MetaCartel Ventures (opens new window) and The LAO (opens new window) investment clubs.
